p.q0: Manuel wants his fourth graders to practice Extensive English in the classroom. He brings the audio of the following conversation:
p.q: After listening to the conversation, one student raises his hand and asks: "Teacher, what are queues?" Which of the following actions is it more appropriate for Manuel to carry out?

as.a: Tell the student the definition of "queue" in English. If he doesn't understand it, translate the word "queue" into Spanish.
Explain to the students that queue is a British word and its synonym in American English is row. Ask the student if he got the idea or not.
Ask four students to come to the front and line up one behind the other. Ask the whole class what their peers are doing and where people usually stand like that.
